channel.title: 🔥 Open Data hot twitter posts | by onData
channel.description: Tweets about open data, which have received at least 10 hearts or retweets, in many languages

item.title: #en @ 1459569309009776648
item.description: Lesson 3: I was only able to do this analysis because the data and materials were open. Open data are great. But (to use a @siminevazire analogy) transparency only opens the hood. You still need to see what the engine looks like.

item.title: #und @ 1459561971355893762
item.description: قانون الشفافية والبيانات المفتوحة أساسيّ للإصلاح، يسري على كلّ الإدارات التي تتعاطى بالشأن العام ولا يزال عالق في #جوارير_عدوان منذ شباط ٢٠٢١ The transparency & open data law is essential for reform and is still stalling at #Georgesadwan drawers since February 2021 #siyese101 https://t.co/NwPIlHbEE8

item.title: #en @ 1459524365595389953
item.description:
#EUSpace for #wetlands monitoring
The #Mississippi River Delta and several other wetlands across the world are threatened by #ClimateChange🌀🌊🌡️, poor human management👷‍♂️ etc.
#EUSpace supplies #OpenData to monitor this loss
⬇️#Copernicus #Sentinel2 🇪🇺🛰️image of 8 November https://t.co/hbmsmgHl63

item.title: #en @ 1458881854090711050
item.description: I think that better data on public transport costs in the UK would be amazing. Ideally much LESS data than we have now. Think about transport in London, the open data on fares is so simple. It's amazingly powerful. Elsewhere we get complexity and nuance which is far worse.

item.title: #en @ 1458868011666968582
item.description:
We're delighted to have been shortlisted in the #opendata award category at #openukcop26 tonight.

item.title: #en @ 1458816839157387272
item.description:
Look, Earth Engine is awesome. But I wish the victory lap included more of a nod towards the open data policies that make it all possible.
No Landsat open data, No Sentinel open data = No Google Earth Engine.

item.title: #en @ 1458796945078640646
item.description: There are some good things about the paper. Data are open on OSF, and upon re-analysis in different software (R) I achieve computational reproducibility for Table 2 and Figure 3 within rounding tolerance. This is already leagues better than many studies with no open data /2
